title.narrative: USAID redacted this field in accordance with the exceptions outlined in the Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act of 2016.

description.narrative: Objectives for Afghanistan: Construction of a state-of-the-art hospital to serve the needs of the local communities in Paktia, Logar, Khost, and Nangarhar provinces was completed by the end of February 2016. Construction of a 20-bed hospital in Khair Kote District of Paktika Province. The project was completed by the end of February 2016. Operation and Maintenance (O&M) Training Program: The 100-bed Gardez and 20-bed Khair Kote hospitals built under the CHEF program are equipped with complicated mechanical and electrical systems that require extensive O&M. To support the sustainability of these facilities, USAID provided the Ministry of Public Health O&M staff with four-five months of training.
USAID redacted this field in accordance with the exceptions outlined in the Foreign Aid Transparency and Accountability Act of 2016.
